Lp spaces

Let {fn}n\set{f_n}_n{fn​}n​ denote a bounded sequence in L2([0,1])L^2\p{\br{0,1}}L2([0,1]). Suppose the sequence {fn}n\set{f_n}_n{fn​}n​ also converges almost everywhere. Show that then {fn}n\set{f_n}_n{fn​}n​ converges in the weak topology on L2([0,1])L^2\p{\br{0,1}}L2([0,1]).
Solution.

Let g∈L2([0,1])g \in L^2\p{\br{0,1}}g∈L2([0,1]). We will show that

∣∫(fn−f)g dx∣≤∫∣fn−f∣∣g∣ dx→n→∞0.\abs{\int \p{f_n - f}g \,\diff{x}} \leq \int \abs{f_n - f}\abs{g} \,\diff{x} \xrightarrow{n\to\infty} 0.∣∣​∫(fn​−f)gdx∣∣​≤∫∣fn​−f∣∣g∣dxn→∞​0.

Let M=sup⁡n∥fn∥L2M = \sup_n \norm{f_n}_{L^2}M=supn​∥fn​∥L2​. By Fatou's lemma, if fff denotes the pointwise limit of {fn}n\set{f_n}_n{fn​}n​, then

∫∣f∣2 dx≤lim inf⁡n→∞∫∣fn∣2 dx≤M,\int \abs{f}^2 \,\diff{x} \leq \liminf_{n\to\infty} \int \abs{f_n}^2 \,\diff{x} \leq M,∫∣f∣2dx≤n→∞liminf​∫∣fn​∣2dx≤M,

so f∈L2f \in L^2f∈L2.

Let ε>0\epsilon > 0ε>0. Since g∈L2([0,1])g \in L^2\p{\br{0,1}}g∈L2([0,1]), there exists R>0R > 0R>0 such that ∥gχB(0,R)c∥L2<ε\norm{g\chi_{B\p{0,R}^\comp}}_{L^2} < \epsilon∥∥​gχB(0,R)c​∥∥​L2​<ε. Also, the map E↦∫E∣g∣2 dxE \mapsto \int_E \abs{g}^2 \,\diff{x}E↦∫E​∣g∣2dx defines a measure absolutely continuous with respect to the Lebesgue measure, so there exists δ>0\delta > 0δ>0 such that if m(E)<δm\p{E} < \deltam(E)<δ, then ∫E∣g∣2 dx<ε2\int_E \abs{g}^2 \,\diff{x} < \epsilon^2∫E​∣g∣2dx<ε2. For B(0,R)B\p{0, R}B(0,R), let An={x∈B(0,R)∣∣fn(x)−f(x)∣≥ε}A_n = \set{x \in B\p{0, R} \mid \abs{f_n\p{x} - f\p{x}} \geq \epsilon}An​={x∈B(0,R)∣∣fn​(x)−f(x)∣≥ε}. Since fn→ff_n \to ffn​→f almost everywhere, fn→ff_n \to ffn​→f in measure, so there exists N∈NN \in \NN∈N so that if n≥Nn \geq Nn≥N, then m(An)≤δm\p{A_n} \leq \deltam(An​)≤δ. Thus, by Cauchy-Schwarz,

∫∣fn−f∣∣g∣ dx=∫B(0,R)c∣fn−f∣∣g∣ dx+∫An∣fn−f∣∣g∣ dx+∫B(0,R)∖An∣fn−f∣∣g∣ dx≤∥fn−f∥L2∥gχB(0,R)c∥L2+∥fn−f∥L2(∫An∣g∣2 dx)1/2+ε∫B(0,R)∖An∣g∣2 dx≤2Mε+2Mε+ε∥g∥L2.\begin{aligned} \int \abs{f_n - f}\abs{g} \,\diff{x} &= \int_{B\p{0,R}^\comp} \abs{f_n - f}\abs{g} \,\diff{x} + \int_{A_n} \abs{f_n - f}\abs{g} \,\diff{x} + \int_{B\p{0,R} \setminus A_n} \abs{f_n - f}\abs{g} \,\diff{x} \\ &\leq \norm{f_n - f}_{L^2} \norm{g\chi_{B\p{0,R}^\comp}}_{L^2} + \norm{f_n - f}_{L^2} \p{\int_{A_n} \abs{g}^2 \,\diff{x}}^{1/2} + \epsilon \int_{B\p{0,R} \setminus A_n} \abs{g}^2 \,\diff{x} \\ &\leq 2M\epsilon + 2M\epsilon + \epsilon \norm{g}_{L^2}. \end{aligned}∫∣fn​−f∣∣g∣dx​=∫B(0,R)c​∣fn​−f∣∣g∣dx+∫An​​∣fn​−f∣∣g∣dx+∫B(0,R)∖An​​∣fn​−f∣∣g∣dx≤∥fn​−f∥L2​∥∥​gχB(0,R)c​∥∥​L2​+∥fn​−f∥L2​(∫An​​∣g∣2dx)1/2+ε∫B(0,R)∖An​​∣g∣2dx≤2Mε+2Mε+ε∥g∥L2​.​

Sending ε→0\epsilon \to 0ε→0, we get the claim.
